title: Svelte Tips and Tricks
excerpt: Some useful tips for writing cleaner and more efficient Svelte code.
content:
Making the Most of Svelte

Svelte is a wonderful framework that brings a fresh approach to building web applications. Here are some tips I've picked up along the way.

Reactivity with Runes

Svelte 5 introduces runes which make reactivity explicit and predictable. Using $state, $derived, and $effect makes your code intentions crystal clear.

Component Composition

Keep components small and focused. Each component should have a single responsibility, making them easier to test and reuse.

Styling Scoped by Default

One of my favorite features of Svelte is that styles are scoped to the component by default. No more CSS class naming conflicts!

Performance Matters

Svelte compiles your components at build time, resulting in highly optimized JavaScript. This means smaller bundles and faster load times for your users.
